general news.headline: US flight carrying third batch of 112 Indian deportees lands in AmritsarA US Air Force C-17 Globemaster landed in Amritsar, carrying 112 Indians deported from the US for illegal residency. This marks the third such arrival in 10 days amid US immigration crackdowns.

Women, children not restrained on 2nd US flight that landed in Amritsar: SourcesA plane carrying 116 Indian deportees from the US landed in Amritsar. Blocked from speaking to my son, haven't seen him in 2 years: Shikhar DhawanFormer India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan expressed his longing to meet and embrace his son. The Champions Trophy winner said it has been two years since he last saw Zoravar and a year since they last spoke.

Yashasvi Jaiswal ruled out of Mumbai's Ranji semi-final due to injuryYashasvi Jaiswal faces a double setback as an ankle injury ruled him out of Mumbai's Ranji Trophy semi-final against Vidarbha, days after his exclusion from India's Champions Trophy squad in a last-minute selection change.

If Haris Rauf has a side strain, he cannot play Champions Trophy: Mohammad AmirFormer pacer Mohammad Amir has expressed his doubts about Haris Rauf's fitness and feels he may not be able to play the Champions Trophy if he has got a side strain. Rauf got injured during the opening match of the tri-series but was deemed to be fit in time for the Champions Trophy.

What went wrong in Bellingham's red card in Madrid vs Osasuna: ExplainedJude Bellingham faces a potential lengthy ban after receiving a controversial red card against Osasuna, with Real Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti insisting it was a misunderstanding and criticising referee José Luis Munuera's officiating decisions.

IPL 2025: Mumbai Indians sign Mujeeb Ur Rahman as Allah Ghazanfar replacementMumbai Indians have announced the signing of Mujeeb ur Rahman as the replacement for the injured Allah Ghazanfar for the upcoming IPL 2025 season on Sunday, February 16.

Champions Trophy: Additional tickets for India matches in Dubai to go on saleAdditional tickets for India's matches in Dubai during the ICC Champions Trophy will go on sale on Sunday, February 16. Apart from the India matches, semi-final 1 will also be played in Dubai.

Champions Trophy Classics: When Hardik Pandya's flair couldn't stop PakistanWhen Hardik Pandya's fiery knock in the 2017 Champions Trophy final gave India hope, only for a mix-up with Ravindra Jadeja to cut it short, leaving fans wondering what could have been.

Rashid Khan bigger cricketer than Wasim Akram: Rashid Latif makes bold claimFormer Pakistan skipper Rashid Latif has made a huge statement that Rashid Khan is a bigger cricketer than Wasim Akram. Rashid has been one of the star players for Afghanistan in the last decade.

First Vishy Anand, now Botez sisters take Gukesh 'hostage' in funny postCanadian chess stars Alexandra and Andrea Botez shared a hilarious "hostage" photo with Indian world champion D Gukesh, delighting fans with their trademark humour after a similar viral post featuring Viswanathan Anand.

Harmanpreet Singh not 'too disappointed' with Spain loss, eyes finishing improvementIndia captain Harmanpreet Singh said that he wasn't too disappointed with the loss to Spain in the FIH Pro League on Saturday, February 15. India lost the match 1-3 despite taking the lead in the match.

Omar Marmoush's hat-trick doesn't surprise Manchester City boss Pep GuardiolaOmar Marmoush's hat-trick against Newcastle United didn't surprise Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola as he felt it was just a matter of time before the Egyptian forward would find form in the Premier League.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
